name: Meet the Sea Dragon!
Description:
Our Boss is finally back from traveling and is available again! Come visit 'Sexy Hookup Resort' and meet the majestic Sea Dragon!
- Tina ♥

theScene: Finally, you arrive at the spot mentioned in Tina's invitation. It described a tiny island a several dozen meters away from the shore, housing a peculiar flat rock the size of a table.
It is a little difficult to tell from this distance, but you're pretty sure this is the right place. Hoping you didn't mistake the location, you prepare to enter the water and look around.
A lone Nereid stands still in the distance, overlooking the island. She notices you and gives a little wave before sitting flat on her ass and pointing to you, then to the island.

With a shrug, you enter the sea, enjoying the pleasantly cool water caressing your body. You'd go for a swim more often, but getting swarmed by Mermaids does not match with your plans most of the time.
Fufu... Oh don't be alarmed, Hero. We are only here to make sure everyone makes it to the Divine Island safely.♥
That's right, our veritable Dragon Goddess resides there.♥ I am sure you'll understand when you see her for yourself.♥
You nod and resume swimming, still feeling a little concerned over the mermaids as you go.
However, they are keeping their distance as promised, and seem to disappear into the water quietly when you safely arrive at the island.

The tiny island is largely empty. A large and flat rock dominates one third of its space. In front of it, you spot a number of markings in the sand. Webbed footprints, scaly trails, dried mucus and other traces left all over the location. The aquatic locals seem to frequent this location.
You approach and examine the rock. Up close, it kind of looks like a makeshift altar, but there is nothing on it beside some stray seaweed.
You hear a quiet splash coming from behind the altar. Carefully, you lean over the flat stone and peek at the waters...
...But see nothing. Thinking you might've imagined it, you step back.
All of a sudden, night falls. The blazing sun disappears almost instantaneously, a gigantic moon replacing it in the skies.
As you're still trying to gather your bearings over the sudden change, something rises from behind the altar...!
The strange-looking dragoness is huge, her human half easily twice as tall as you, to say nothing of the rest of her gargantuan body.
My greetings to you, Hero... Are you here to challenge-...
With a loud splash, she disappears underwater as suddenly as she appeared.
The weather normalizes as well, the mystical night fading without a trace, giving place to the familiar oppressive heat of the beach.
Baffled by what has just transpired you look around for support or a possible explanation.
You hear muffled giggles from behind and turn around to see several mermaids in the water, with one of them clumsily climbing unto the land, while the others are pushing her from behind.
Finally plopping upon the land, she hurriedly pulls herself closer to you, addressing you in a panicked manner.
Oh Hero, we are so, so sorry! Our Lady suddenly retreated back to her Undersea Chambers again! P-please we have to do something, or she may lose her job here!
Ye- oh, um, I mean, it's not my place to say... This never happened on the job before...
A-anyway, I beg of you, Hero! Please let Miss Tina know that this happened! I am sure she could convince our Lady to meet you properly... I hope...
You can only shrug and promise to call Tina next time, reassuring the flustered Mermaid that it'll be fine. For now, however, you return back to the town to get some rest.
You arrive at the location close to the dragon's island again, but have little reason to visit the place right now.
First, you should let Tina know about what happened last time.
You arrive to the island a little later than Tina and see her already talking to the Dragon, who, upon seeing you, flushes crimson and looks like she's about to run away again.
To avoid scaring her off you halt your advance and try to listen in from a distance. You also notice a number of curious Nereids and Mermaids peeking from the waters.

Cetty! Are you listening? You can't just run off because {thePlayerName}- *unintelligible*. Mrs. Felicia wouldn't- *unintelligible*. Have some confidence, your combat moves are incredibly l- *unintelligible*... I am sure he will f- *unintelligible* you when he sees them.
Okay... I'll do it... I'll fight him! Just... just give me a moment to prepare, then send him in, okay?
But I am staying here, and if you run off again, I am telling Mrs. Felicia! She'll set you straight for sure.
N-no need! No need to bother Mrs. Felicia. I'll do just fine, I promise.
The dragonness retreats underwater for the moment and Tina walks over to you.
I am so, so sorry that she is like this, {thePlayerName}. She asked for a moment to prepare, so let's wait for a bit.
You inquire about what was the problem in the first place.
Heehee... girls secret. I can't tell you that I'm afraid.♥
But don't worry, I think I convinced her to do this. I'll just sit here quietly in case she gets any funny ideas, so don't let me distract you two.
Tina looks around briefly and giggles.
I think you'll have some audience from the fishies anyway.
Just like the first time, night falls over the sea suddenly.
Ohh, looks like she's ready! I love it when she does this trick, that moon is so ridiculously big and pretty!
Okay, I'll get out of the way, good luck there!
She hops some distance away with a little wave.
You take a deep breath to prepare yourself for the fight and approach the altar.
As you approach, the sea dragoness rises slowly from the water, looking far more composed than before.
I welcome you, Human Hero. Dragon Goddess Cetuspeanna accepts your challenge!
Overwhelmed by the rampant magic spell, Cetuspeanna lays motionless in the shallow waters...
The magical night fades away quickly, giving way to the usual sunny ambience.
H-hero, that was going too far! I've never seen anyone bully the Goddess so much!
It looked like it felt really good though...
N-not now! We have to bring her home...
Umm, hero, this is your reward... She was supposed to give it herself if you won, but...
The mermaid procurs an expertly-crafted whistle made of coral from the dragoness' unconscious body and hands it to you.
When the season is right, you can use this to travel to far, deep places. You'll know it when the time comes.
Leaving behind that cryptic message, the Mermaids begin bustling around their unconscious goddess, trying to move her.
More Mermaids emerge from water, splashing around and helping their sisters to drag the giant dragoness underwater before disappearing from view...
You shrug and decide to return to town, hoping Cetuspeanna is not too upset about this loss.
Panting heavily Cetuspeanna retreats farther into water, signaling that the fight is over.
Haa... Good job, Hero. You may be the first adventurer to defeat me here, as a part of the resort team.
Truly, congratulations! This is a special occasion, as I get to gift you a special item.
The dragoness procurs an expertly-crafted whistle made of coral and hands it to you gingerly.
When the season is right, this will help you travel to far, deep places. You will know how to use it when the time comes.
Leaving behind that cryptic message she draws back further into the water and gives you a little wave.
Now, I would love to get to know my subjugator better, but I must report my loss right away. It's part of the contract. So come see me later sometime, okay?

The giant dragoness waves one last time and dives underwater with a loud splash, disappearing from view... You look around and don't see anyone else, figuring Tina and the spectating locals already left.
You pocket the whistle and decide to return to town, still feeling a little pumped from the intense and beautiful fight.
You arrive at the dragon's altar once more, intent on challenging her again!
Just like the last time, night falls over the sea suddenly.
As you approach closer, the sea dragoness rises slowly from the water.
I welcome you again, Human Hero. Dragon Goddess Cetuspeanna accepts your challenge!
You return to Cetuspeanna's island and sit down on the altar, waiting for her arrival. Hopefully the dragoness is not too far.
As if alleviating your concerns, Cetuspeanna emerges from the water gracefully.
Slithering unto land, she wraps her long tail around the altar, propping up her upper body across from you, perhaps a little too closely.
So, what did you want to do today?
You return to Cetuspeanna's island and sit down on the altar, waiting for her arrival. Hopefully the dragoness is not too far, and not too upset about the magic fiasco from the last time.
Cetuspeanna emerges from the water, flushed in the face but not looking too angry.
Hello again, {thePlayerName}... Umm... About the last time...
You start to apologize for what happened, but she interrupts you.
N-no no, the fault is my own... I just ask that you... Don't tell anyone about that, okay?
You nod in agreement, not sure if that's gonna help because the Mermaids probably told everyone by now, but she visibly relaxes nonetheless.
Slithering unto land, she wraps her long tail around the altar, propping up her upper body across from you, perhaps a little too closely.
So, let's forget about that. What did you want to do today?
'Why did you run away at first?'
No, not at all. I am not a goddess, and not even a dragon per se.
You feel confused and ask her to elaborate.

I don't recall the circumstances of my birth. I am an orphan, raised by the local seafolk who've never seen anything quite like me. So for a while everyone just assumed I was a sea serpent from a deeper sea area.
That was until I met a real sea serpent who looked really different from myself.
She didn't have a... {i}tail{/i} quite like mine, or any tentacles.
Her tentacles wiggle demonstratively, but your eyes stealthily wander to her moist tail pussy for a moment...
So I tried to do some research into my origin, and it failed completely. That was until the humans came along, founding their guilds and research facilities.
Wait... how old are you again?
I decided I would visit the human wizards. I heard they were invested in classifying the monster races, so I figured they could identify me as well.
They got into a huge fight about it.♪
Fundamentally, I turned out to be a sea slug. A really long, unusually ancient sea slug. That was the only thing they all agreed upon.
I don't know if you've seen a sea slug, but they're nothing like me. Our slippery and squishy bodies are the only thing we have in common, really.

So they tried to figure out why I looked different. One of the wizards insisted I was a chimera, due to the presence of horns, my tail... organ... and tentacles, all of which are uncharacteristic for sea slugs.
The others insisted my chimeric traits were too insignificant and didn't explain my unusually large capacity for magic.
I did fly all the way from the sea to their place. They were pretty shocked by it.♪
So they ran some tests and received what they called a 'draconic response'. They also noticed my strong affinity for the holy element. Of course, that's not enough to be considered a goddess.
So in the end, they classified me as a 'draconic mollusc' and bought me a cake. Wizards are so oddly adorable at times, aren't they?
Oh I am sorry, I talked too much about this. I hope I didn't bore you, we should change the subject.

EventText.NameOfScene: 'Why did you run away at first?'
